abstract: Study in Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society finds intense, bright lightning storms occur in region around Lake Maracaibo in Venezuela 297 days a year, prompting scientists to declare area lightning capital of the world.
lead_paragraph: Locals in the area known as Lake Maracaibo, by the Catatumbo River can expect electrical storms during more than 80 percent of the year.

headline.main: A Place Where Lightning Strikes Almost 300 Days a Year
headline.print_headline: Bright Skies: The Lightning Capital of the World

snippet: Locals in the area known as Lake Maracaibo, by the Catatumbo River can expect electrical storms during more than 80 percent of the year.

keywords.value: Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society
